description: Describes SRT Receiver transport parameters. The constraints in this schema are minimum constraints, but may be further constrained at the constraints endpoint. SRT Receivers must support all parameters in this schema.
title: SRT Receiver Transport Parameters
Receiver Input

destination_ip.description: SRT Destination IP address (IP address of the interface bound to the Receiver). If the parameter is set to 'auto' the Receiver should establish for itself which interface it should use, based on its own internal configuration.

destination_port.description: SRT Destination Port. If the parameter is set to 'auto' the Receiver should establish for itself which port it should use, based on its own internal configuration.

source_ip.description: SRT Source IP address (IP address of the Sender). If the parameter is set to 'auto' the Receiver should establish for itself which address it should use, based on its own internal configuration. A null value indicates that the Receiver has not yet been configured or is configured in listener mode. This address is used in caller and rendezvous mode to connect to the Sender.

source_port.description: SRT Source Port. If the parameter is set to 'auto' the Receiver should establish for itself which port it should use, based on its own internal configuration. This port is used in caller and rendezvous mode to connect to the Sender

protocol.description: Indicate the SRT sub-protocol(s) to use

latency.description: SRT target latency in milliseconds. The value 0 indicate to automatically set the latency
